intro: Storthocalyx corymbosus, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Leguminosae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces leguminous pods that contain flat, edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The tree thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
